data.title: The Right Stuff: Gay Cable Network Archives: NYU Special Collections Finding Aids
data.meta_description: Founded in 1982 by Louis P. Maletta, the Gay Cable Network was the premiere media chronicler of events and personalities of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) community for nearly two decades. GCN programming broadcast on public access television in New York City and other major cities worldwide.
